table\n        JScrollPane scrollPane = new JScrollPane(studentTable);\n        scrollPane.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(600, 300));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Set up the layout of the GUI\n     */\n    private void setupLayout() {\n        // Set layout\n        setLayout(new BorderLayout(10, 10));\n        \n        // Title panel\n        JPanel titlePanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());\n        titlePanel.add(titleLabel, BorderLayout.CENTER);\n        titlePanel.setBorder(BorderFactory.createEmptyBorder(10, 10, 10, 10));\n        add(titlePanel, BorderLayout.NORTH);\n        \n        // Table panel\n        JScrollPane scrollPane = new JScrollPane(studentTable);\n        scrollPane.setBorder(BorderFactory.createTitledBorder("Students"));\n        add(scrollPane, BorderLayout.CENTER);\n        \n        // Button panel\n        JPanel buttonPanel = new JPanel(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.CENTER, 20, 10));\n        buttonPanel.add(confirmButton);\n        buttonPanel.add(cancelButton);\n        add(buttonPanel, BorderLayout.SOUTH);\n        \n        // Status bar\n        JPanel statusPanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());\n        statusPanel.setBorder(BorderFactory.createEtchedBorder());\n        statusPanel.add(statusLabel, BorderLayout.CENTER);\n        add(statusPanel, BorderLayout.PAGE_END);\n        \n        // Add padding\n        ((JPanel) getContentPane()).setBorder(BorderFactory.createEmptyBorder(10, 10, 10, 10));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Configure the main frame\n     */\n    private void configureFrame() {\n        setTitle("ATA System - Insert Delay");\n        setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);\n        setSize(700, 500);\n        setLocationRelativeTo(null); // Center on screen\n        setResizable(true);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Set the data handler for server communication\n     * @param dataHandler The DataHandler instance\n     */\n    public void setDataHandler(DataHandler dataHandler) {\n        this.dataHandler = dataHandler;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handle button click events\n     * @param e The ActionEvent\n     */\n    @Override\n    public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {\n        if (e.getSource() == confirmButton) {\n            handleConfirm();\n        } else if (e.getSource() == cancelButton) {\n            handleCancel();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handle Confirm button click\n     */\n    private void handleConfirm() {\n        try {\n            // Collect delay entries\n            List<DelayEntry> delayEntries = collectDelayEntries();\n            \n            if (delayEntries.isEmpty()) {\n                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this,\n                    "No delays selected. Please select at least one student with delay.",\n                    "No Delays Selected",\n                    JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Validate delay entries\n            StringBuilder validationErrors = new StringBuilder();\n            for (DelayEntry entry : delayEntries) {\n                if (!entry.isValid()) {\n                    validationErrors.append("Invalid entry for student: ")\n                                   .append(entry.getStudentName())\n                                   .append("\\n");\n                }\n            }\n            \n            if (validationErrors.length() > 0) {\n                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this,\n                    "Validation errors:\\n" + validationErrors.toString(),\n                    "Validation Error",\n                    JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            int confirmation = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(this,\n                "Are you sure you want to submit " + delayEntries.size() + " delay entries?",\n                "Confirm Submission",\n                JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION);\n            \n            if (confirmation == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) {\n                // Send data to server\n                if (dataHandler != null) {\n                    boolean success = dataHandler.sendDelayData(delayEntries);\n                    \n                    if (success) {\n                        statusLabel.setText("Data sent successfully!");\n                        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this,\n                            "Delay data has been successfully entered into the system.",\n                            "Success",\n                            JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);\n                        \n                        // Reset form as per postconditions (initial screen shown again)\n                        resetForm();\n                    } else {\n                        statusLabel.setText("Error sending data to server");\n                        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this,\n                            "Failed to send data to server. Please try again.",\n                            "Server Error",\n                            JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    // Simulate success if no data handler is set (for testing)\n                    statusLabel.setText("Data ready (no server connection)");\n                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this,\n                        delayEntries.size() + " delay entries collected successfully.\\n" +\n                        "Simulated server submission (DataHandler not configured).",\n                        "Simulation Mode",\n                        JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);\n                    resetForm();\n                }\n            }\n            \n        } catch (Exception ex) {\n            statusLabel.setText("Error: " + ex.getMessage());\n            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this,\n                "An error occurred: " + ex.getMessage(),\n                "Error",\n                JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handle Cancel button click\n     */\n    private void handleCancel() {\n        int confirmation = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(this,\n            "Are you sure you want to cancel? All unsaved changes will be lost.",\n            "Confirm Cancel",\n            JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION,\n            JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);\n        \n        if (confirmation == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) {\n            // Close the application as per postconditions\n            dispose();\n            System.exit(0);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Collect delay entries from the table\n     * @return List of DelayEntry objects\n     */\n    private List<DelayEntry> collectDelayEntries() {\n        List<DelayEntry> entries = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        for (int i = 0; i < students.size(); i++) {\n            Student student = students.get(i);\n            Boolean hasDelay = (Boolean) tableModel.getValueAt(i, COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX);\n            Object minutesObj = tableModel.getValueAt(i, COL_DELAY_MINUTES);\n            \n            // Convert delay minutes to integer\n            int delayMinutes = 0;\n            if (minutesObj != null) {\n                if (minutesObj instanceof Number) {\n                    delayMinutes = ((Number) minutesObj).intValue();\n                } else if (minutesObj instanceof String) {\n                    try {\n                        delayMinutes = Integer.parseInt(minutesObj.toString());\n                    } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                        delayMinutes = 0;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Only create entry if delay is checked and minutes > 0\n            if (hasDelay != null && hasDelay && delayMinutes > 0) {\n                DelayEntry entry = new DelayEntry(\n                    student.getStudentId(),\n                    student.getFullName(),\n                    delayMinutes,\n                    currentClass,\n                    ataStaffName\n                );\n                entries.add(entry);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return entries;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * tableModel.setValueAt(false, i, COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX);\n            tableModel.setValueAt(0, i, COL_DELAY_MINUTES);\n        }\n        \n        // Reset status\n        statusLabel.setText("Form reset - Ready for new entries");\n        studentTable.repaint();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Custom table model for student data\n     */\n    private class StudentTableModel extends AbstractTableModel       \n        public StudentTableModel(List<Student> students) {\n            this.students = students;\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public int getRowCount() {\n            return students.size();\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public int getColumnCount() {\n            return COLUMN_NAMES.length;\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public String getColumnName(int column) {\n            return COLUMN_NAMES[column];\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public Class<?> getColumnClass(int columnIndex) {\n            return columnClasses[columnIndex];\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public boolean isCellEditable(int rowIndex, int columnIndex) {\n            // Only delay checkbox and delay minutes are editable\n            // Delay minutes is only editable when delay is checked (handled elsewhere)\n            return columnIndex == COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX || columnIndex == COL_DELAY_MINUTES;\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public Object getValueAt(int rowIndex, int columnIndex) {\n            Student student = students.get(rowIndex);\n            switch (columnIndex) {\n                case 0: // Present\n                    return student.isPresent();\n                case 1: // Student ID\n                    return student.getStudentId();\n                case 2: // Name\n                    return student.getFullName();\n                case 3: // Delay checkbox\n                    return student.hasDelay();\n                case 4: // Delay minutes\n                    return student.getDelayMinutes();\n                default:\n                    return null;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public void setValueAt(Object aValue, int rowIndex, int columnIndex) {\n            Student student = students.get(rowIndex);\n            switch (columnIndex) {\n                case 0: // Present\n                    student.setPresent((Boolean) aValue);\n                    break;\n                case 3: // Delay checkbox\n                    boolean hasDelay = (Boolean) aValue;\n                    student.setHasDelay(hasDelay);\n                    if (!hasDelay) {\n                        // Auto-clear delay minutes when delay is unchecked\n                        student.setDelayMinutes(0);\n                    }\n                    break;\n                case 4: // Delay minutes\n                    try {\n                        int minutes = 0;\n                        if (aValue != null) {\n                            if (aValue instanceof Number) {\n                                minutes = ((Number) aValue).intValue();\n                            } else if (aValue instanceof String) {\n                                minutes = Integer.parseInt(aValue.toString());\n                            }\n                        }\n                        student.setDelayMinutes(minutes);\n                        // Auto-check delay when minutes are set\n                        if (minutes > 0) {\n                            student.setHasDelay(true);\n                            fireTableCellUpdated(rowIndex, COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX);\n                        }\n                    } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                        // Keep current value if invalid\n                    }\n                    break;\n            }\n            fireTableCellUpdated(rowIndex, columnIndex);\n        }\n    }\n    \n This class should handle sending delay data to a server, with proper error handling, simulation mode for testing, and connection management as mentioned in the postconditions (SMOS server).\n\n```java\nimport java.util.List;\nimport java.util.ArrayList;\nimport java.io.*;\nimport java.net.*;\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\nimport java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;\nimport javax.swing.JOptionPane;\n\n/**\n * DataHandler class responsible for server communication.\n * Handles sending delay data to the server with error handling and retry logic.\n * Supports simulation mode for testing without actual server connection.\n */\npublic class DataHandler {\n    // Configuration constants\n    private static final String DEFAULT_SERVER_URL = "http://localhost:8080/api/delays";\n    private static final int CONNECTION_TIMEOUT = 10000; // 10 seconds\n    private static final int READ_TIMEOUT = 15000; // 15 seconds\n    private static final int MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS = 3;\n    \n    // File constants for data persistence\n    private static final String DATA_DIR = "ata_delay_data";\n    private static final String BACKUP_FILE_FORMAT = "yyyyMMdd_HHmmss";\n    \n    private String serverUrl;\n    private boolean simulationMode;\n    private String currentStaffName;\n    private List<DelayEntry> pendingEntries;\n    \n    // Logging and status\n    private StringBuilder operationLog;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor with default server URL\n     * @param staffName Name of the ATA staff using the system\n     */\n    public DataHandler(String staffName) {\n        this(DEFAULT_SERVER_URL, staffName);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor with custom server URL\n     * @param serverUrl The URL of the server endpoint\n     * @param staffName Name of the ATA staff using the system\n     */\n    public DataHandler(String serverUrl, String staffName) {\n        this.serverUrl = serverUrl;\n        this.currentStaffName = staffName;\n        this.simulationMode = false;\n        this.pendingEntries = new ArrayList<>();\n        this.operationLog = new StringBuilder();\n        \n        log("DataHandler initialized for staff: " + staffName);\n        log("Server URL: " + serverUrl);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Enable or disable simulation mode\n     * @param simulationMode True for simulation mode, false for real server communication\n     */\n    public void setSimulationMode(boolean simulationMode) {\n        this.simulationMode = simulationMode;\n        log("Simulation mode: " + (simulationMode ? "ENABLED" : "DISABLED"));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Send delay data to the server\n     * @param delayEntries List of delay entries to send\n     * @return True if successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean sendDelayData(List<DelayEntry> delayEntries) {\n        if (delayEntries == null || delayEntries.isEmpty()) {\n            log("No delay entries to send");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        log("Preparing to send " + delayEntries.size() + " delay entries");\n        \n        // Validate all entries before sending\n        String validationError = validateDelayEntries(delayEntries);\n        if (validationError != null) {\n            log("Validation failed: " + validationError);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Store pending entries\n        pendingEntries = new ArrayList<>(delayEntries);\n        \n        // Check for simulation mode\n        if (simulationMode) {\n            return simulateServerSubmission(delayEntries);\n        }\n        \n        // Real server communication\n        return sendToServer(delayEntries);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Send data to the actual server with retry logic\n     * @param delayEntries List of delay entries\n     * @return True if successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean sendToServer(List<DelayEntry> delayEntries) {\n        log("Attempting to connect to server: " + serverUrl);\n        \n        // Try multiple times in case of connection issues\n        for (int attempt = 1; attempt <= MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS; attempt++) {\n            try {\n                log("Connection attempt " + attempt + " of " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS);\n                \n                // Create HTTP connection\n                URL url = new URL(serverUrl);\n                HttpURLConnection connection = (HttpURLConnection) url.openConnection();\n                \n                // Configure connection\n                connection.setRequestMethod("POST");\n                connection.setRequestProperty("Content-Type", "application/json");\n                connection.setRequestProperty("Accept", "application/json");\n                connection.setRequestProperty("User-Agent", "ATA-Delay-System/1.0");\n                connection.setConnectTimeout(CONNECTION_TIMEOUT);\n                connection.setReadTimeout(READ_TIMEOUT);\n                connection.setDoOutput(true);\n                \n                // Create JSON payload\n                String jsonPayload = createJsonPayload(delayEntries);\n                log("Payload size: " + jsonPayload.length() + " bytes");\n                \n                // Send data\n                try (OutputStream os = connection.getOutputStream()) {\n                    byte[] input = jsonPayload.getBytes("utf-8");\n                    os.write(input, 0, input.length);\n                }\n                \n                // Get response\n                int responseCode = connection.getResponseCode();\n                log("Server response code: " + responseCode);\n                \n                // Read response\n                StringBuilder response = new StringBuilder();\n                try (BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(\n                        new InputStreamReader(connection.getInputStream(), "utf-8"))) {\n                    String responseLine;\n                    while ((responseLine = br.readLine()) != null) {\n                        response.append(responseLine.trim());\n                    }\n                }\n                \n                // Handle response\n                if (responseCode == HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK || \n                    responseCode == HttpURLConnection.HTTP_CREATED) {\n                    log("Server accepted data successfully");\n                    log("Response: " + response.toString());\n                    \n                    // Clear pending entries on success\n                    pendingEntries.clear();\n                    createBackupFile(delayEntries, true);\n                    return true;\n                } else {\n                    log("Server rejected data with code: " + responseCode);\n                    log("Error response: " + response.toString());\n                    \n                    // Save to backup file for retry\n                    createBackupFile(delayEntries, false);\n                    \n                    // Wait before retry (exponential backoff)\n                    if (attempt < MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                        int waitTime = 1000 * (int) Math.pow(2, attempt - 1); // 1s, 2s, 4s\n                        log("Waiting " + waitTime + "ms before retry...");\n                        Thread.sleep(waitTime);\n                    }\n                }\n                \n                connection.disconnect();\n                \n            } catch (SocketTimeoutException e) {\n                log("Connection timeout on attempt " + attempt + ": " + e.getMessage());\n                createBackupFile(delayEntries, false);\n                \n                if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                    log("Max retry attempts reached. Data saved to backup.");\n                    showConnectionError("Connection timeout. Data saved locally for later submission.");\n                }\n                \n            } catch (ConnectException e) {\n                log("Connection refused on attempt " + attempt + ": " + e.getMessage());\n                createBackupFile(delayEntries, false);\n                \n                if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                    log("Max retry attempts reached. SMOS server connection interrupted.");\n                    showConnectionError("SMOS server connection interrupted. Data saved locally.");\n                    \n                    // SMOS server interruption as per postconditions\n                    handleSMOSServerInterruption();\n                }\n                \n            } catch (IOException e) {\n                log("IO error on attempt " + attempt + ": " + e.getMessage());\n                createBackupFile(delayEntries, false);\n                \n                if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                    log("Max retry attempts reached due to IO error.");\n                    showConnectionError("Network error. Please check your connection.");\n                }\n                \n            } catch (Exception e) {\n                log("Unexpected error on attempt " + attempt + ": " + e.getMessage());\n                e.printStackTrace();\n                createBackupFile(delayEntries, false);\n                \n                if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                    log("Max retry attempts reached due to unexpected error.");\n                    showConnectionError("Unexpected error occurred: " + e.getMessage());\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulate server submission (for testing without actual server)\n     * @param delayEntries List of delay entries\n     * @return Always returns true for simulation\n     */\n    private boolean simulateServerSubmission(List<DelayEntry> delayEntries) {\n        log("SIMULATION MODE: Simulating server submission");\n        \n        try {\n            // Simulate network delay\n            Thread.sleep(1500);\n            \n            // Validate in simulation\n            String validationError = validateDelayEntries(delayEntries);\n            if (validationError != null) {\n                log("SIMULATION: Validation failed - " + validationError);\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Create backup file even in simulation\n            createBackupFile(delayEntries, true);\n            \n            // Log simulated success\n            log("SIMULATION: Successfully submitted " + delayEntries.size() + " entries");\n            for (DelayEntry entry : delayEntries) {\n                log("SIMULATION: " + entry.getSummary());\n            }\n            \n            // Clear pending entries\n            pendingEntries.clear();\n            \n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            log("SIMULATION: Interrupted during simulation");\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log("SIMULATION: Error during simulation - " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validate a list of delay entries\n     * @param delayEntries List of delay entries to validate\n     * @return Error message if validation fails, null if valid\n     */\n    private String validateDelayEntries(List<DelayEntry> delayEntries) {\n        if (delayEntries == null) {\n            return "Delay entries list is null";\n        }\n        \n        if (delayEntries.isEmpty()) {\n            return "No delay entries to process";\n        }\n        \n        StringBuilder errors = new StringBuilder();\n        int errorCount = 0;\n        \n        for (int i = 0; i < delayEntries.size(); i++) {\n            DelayEntry entry = delayEntries.get(i);\n            \n            if (entry == null) {\n                errors.append("Entry ").append(i).append(" is null\\n");\n                errorCount++;\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            if (!entry.isValid()) {\n                errors.append("Entry ").append(i).append(" is invalid: ")\n                      .append(entry.getStudentId()).append("\\n");\n                errorCount++;\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            // Additional validation rules\n            if (entry.getDelayMinutes() <= 0) {\n                errors.append("Entry ").append(i).append(" has invalid delay minutes: ")\n                      .append(entry.getDelayMinutes()).append("\\n");\n                errorCount++;\n            }\n            \n            if (entry.getStudentId() == null || entry.getStudentId().trim().isEmpty()) {\n                errors.append("Entry ").append(i).append(" has empty student ID\\n");\n                errorCount++;\n            }\n            \n            if (entry.getEntryBy() == null || entry.getEntryBy().trim().isEmpty()) {\n                errors.append("Entry ").append(i).append(" has empty staff identifier\\n");\n                errorCount++;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (errorCount > 0) {\n            return "Found " + errorCount + " validation error(s):\\n" + errors.toString();\n        }\n        \n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Create JSON payload from delay entries\n     * @param delayEntries List of delay entries\n     * @return JSON string\n     */\n    private String createJsonPayload(List<DelayEntry> delayEntries) {\n        StringBuilder json = new StringBuilder();\n        json.append("{\\n");\n        json.append("  \\"staff\\": \\"").append(currentStaffName).append("\\",\\n");\n        json.append("  \\"timestamp\\": \\"").append(LocalDateTime.now()).append("\\",\\n");\n        json.append("  \\"entries\\": [\\n");\n        \n        for (int i = 0; i < delayEntries.size(); i++) {\n            DelayEntry entry = delayEntries.get(i);\n            json.append("    {\\n");\n            json.append("      \\"studentId\\": \\"").append(entry.getStudentId()).append("\\",\\n");\n            json.append("      \\"studentName\\": \\"").append(entry.getStudentName()).append("\\",\\n");\n            json.append("      \\"className\\": \\"").append(entry.getClassName()).append("\\",\\n");\n            json.append("      \\"delayMinutes\\": ").append(entry.getDelayMinutes()).append(",\\n");\n            json.append("      \\"entryTime\\": \\"").append(entry.getFormattedDateTime()).append("\\"\\n");\n            \n            if (i < delayEntries.size() - 1) {\n                json.append("    },\\n");\n            } else {\n                json.append("    }\\n");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        json.append("  ]\\n");\n        json.append("}");\n        \n        return json.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Create a backup file for data persistence\n     * @param delayEntries List of delay entries\n     * @param success Whether the operation was successful\n     */\n    private void createBackupFile(List<DelayEntry> delayEntries, boolean success) {\n        try {\n            // Create data directory if it doesn\'t exist\n            File dataDir = new File(DATA_DIR);\n            if (!dataDir.exists()) {\n                dataDir.mkdirs();\n            }\n            \n            // Create filename with timestamp\n            String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(\n                DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern(BACKUP_FILE_FORMAT));\n            String status = success ? "success" : "pending";\n            String filename = DATA_DIR + File.separator + \n                             "delay_data_" + timestamp + "_" + status + ".csv";\n            \n            // Write CSV file\n            try (PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter(filename))) {\n                // Write header\n                writer.println("studentId,studentName,delayMinutes,className,entryBy,entryDateTime");\n                \n                // Write data\n                for (DelayEntry entry : delayEntries) {\n                    writer.println(entry.toCSVString());\n                }\n                \n                log("Backup file created: " + filename + " (" + delayEntries.size() + " entries)");\n                \n            } catch (IOException e) {\n                log("Error creating backup file: " + e.getMessage());\n            }\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log("Unexpected error creating backup: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handle SMOS server interruption as per postconditions\n     */\n    private void handleSMOSServerInterruption() {\n        log("SMOS SERVER INTERRUPTION HANDLED");\n        \n        // In a real implementation, this would:\n        // 1. Switch to backup server if available\n        // 2. Notify administrators\n        // 3. Enable offline mode\n        // 4. Schedule retry for pending data\n        \n        // For now, just log and notify user\n        showConnectionError("SMOS server connection interrupted. Working in offline mode.");\n        \n        // Switch to simulation mode temporarily\n        boolean wasSimulation = simulationMode;\n        simulationMode = true;\n        log("Temporarily switched to simulation mode due to SMOS interruption");\n        \n        // Try to send pending entries in simulation mode\n        if (!pendingEntries.isEmpty()) {\n            log("Attempting to process " + pendingEntries.size() + " pending entries in simulation");\n            simulateServerSubmission(new ArrayList<>(pendingEntries));\n        }\n        \n        // Restore original mode\n        simulationMode = wasSimulation;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Show connection error message to user\n     * @param message Error message\n     */\n    private void showConnectionError(String message) {\n        // In a real application, this would update the UI status\n        // For now, we\'ll just log it\n        log("USER NOTIFICATION: " + message);\n        \n        // Could show a dialog if running in GUI context\n        // JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, message, "Connection Error", JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Log operation message\n     * @param message Message to log\n     */\n    private void log(String message) {\n        String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("HH:mm:ss"));\n        String logMessage = "[" + timestamp + "] " + message;\n        operationLog.append(logMessage).append("\\n");\n        System.out.println(logMessage); // Also print to console for debugging\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the operation log\n     * @return String containing all logged operations\n     */\n    public String getOperationLog() {\n        return operationLog.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clear the operation log\n     */\n    public void clearOperationLog() {\n        operationLog = new StringBuilder();\n        log("Operation log cleared");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get pending entries count\n     * @return Number of pending entries\n     */\n    public int getPendingEntriesCount() {\n        return pendingEntries.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get server URL\n     * @return Current server URL\n     */\n    public String getServerUrl() {\n        return serverUrl;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Set server URL\n     * @param serverUrl New server URL\n     */\n    public void setServerUrl(String serverUrl) {\n        this.serverUrl = serverUrl;\n        log("Server URL updated to: " + serverUrl);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Test server connection\n     * @return True if connection test is successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean testConnection() {\n        if (simulationMode) {\n            log("Simulation mode: Connection test skipped");\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            URL url = new URL(serverUrl);\n            HttpURLConnection connection = (HttpURLConnection) url.openConnection();\n            connection.setRequestMethod("HEAD");\n            connection.setConnectTimeout(5000);\n            connection.setReadTimeout(5000);\n            \n            int responseCode = connection.getResponseCode();\n            connection.disconnect();\n            \n            boolean success = (responseCode == HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK);\n            log("Connection test " + (success ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED") + " (code: " + responseCode + ")");\n            return success;\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log("Connection test failed: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Save operation log to file\n     * @return True if successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean saveLogToFile() {\n        try {\n            File dataDir = new File(DATA_DIR);\n            if (!dataDir.exists()) {\n                dataDir.mkdirs();\n            }\n            \n            String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(\n                DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd"));\n            String filename = DATA_DIR + File.separator\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished. Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/InsertDelayAta_1766923906/InsertDelayAtaApp.java has been successfully created, with content:
import javax.swing.*;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;
import java.awt.event.WindowAdapter;
import java.awt.event.WindowEvent;

/**
 * InsertDelayAtaApp - Main application class for the ATA Delay Insertion System.
 * This class coordinates the entire application flow including authentication,
 * class selection, GUI initialization, and data handling.
 * Implements the complete InsertDelayAta use case.
 */
public class InsertDelayAtaApp {
    // System configuration
    private static final String APP_NAME = "ATA Delay Insertion System";
    private static final String VERSION = "1.0";
    private static final String DEFAULT_SERVER_URL = "http://localhost:8080/api/delays";
    
    // Application state
    private String currentStaffId;
    private String currentClassName;
    private boolean isAuthenticated;
    private DataHandler dataHandler;
    private InsertDelayAtaGUI currentGUI;
    
    /**
     * Main entry point of the application
     * @param args Command line arguments
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        // Ensure GUI runs on Event Dispatch Thread
        SwingUtilities.invokeLater(() -> {
            try {
                InsertDelayAtaApp app = new InsertDelayAtaApp();
                app.start();
            } catch (Exception e) {
                handleFatalError("Failed to start application", e);
            }
        });
    }
    
    /**
     * Constructor - Initializes application state
     */
    public InsertDelayAtaApp() {
        this.isAuthenticated = false;
        this.currentStaffId = null;
        this.currentClassName = null;
        this.dataHandler = null;
        this.currentGUI = null;
        
        System.out.println(APP_NAME + " v" + VERSION + " initialized.");
        System.out.println("=====================================");
    }
    
    /**
     * Starts the application flow
     */
    public void start() {
        System.out.println("Starting ATA Delay Insertion System...");
        
        try {
            // Step 1: User authentication (Precondition: user must be logged in as ATA staff)
            if (!performAuthentication()) {
                System.out.println("Authentication failed. Application terminating.");
                return;
            }
            
            // Step 2: Class selection (Precondition: user must have selected a class)
            if (!performClassSelection()) {
                System.out.println("Class selection cancelled. Application terminating.");
                return;
            }
            
            // Step 3: Initialize data handler with staff credentials
            initializeDataHandler();
            
            // Step 4: Load student data for the selected class
            List<Student> students = loadClassStudents();
            if (students == null || students.isEmpty()) {
                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null,
                    "No students found for class: " + currentClassName,
                    "No Data",
                    JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);
                return;
            }
            
            // Step 5: Create and show the main GUI
            startMainGUI(students);
            
        } catch (Exception e) {
            handleFatalError("Application error occurred", e);
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Perform user authentication as per preconditions
     * @return True if authentication successful, false otherwise
     */
    private boolean performAuthentication() {
        System.out.println("Starting authentication process...");
        
        // In a real application, this would connect to an authentication service
        // For this example, we'll use a simple dialog-based authentication
        while (true) {
            AuthenticationDialog authDialog = new AuthenticationDialog();
            authDialog.setVisible(true);
            
            if (!authDialog.isAuthenticated()) {
                // User cancelled
                System.out.println("Authentication cancelled by user.");
                return false;
            }
            
            currentStaffId = authDialog.getStaffId();
            System.out.println("Authentication successful for staff: " + currentStaffId);
            
            // Additional authentication validation could be added here
            return true;
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Perform class selection as per preconditions
     * @return True if class selected successfully, false otherwise
     */
    private boolean performClassSelection() {
        System.out.println("Starting class selection...");
        
        // In a real application, this would fetch classes from a database
        // For this example, we'll use a list of predefined classes
        String[] availableClasses = {
            "ATA Class 101 - Morning",
            "ATA Class 102 - Afternoon", 
            "ATA Class 201 - Advanced",
            "ATA Class 301 - Professional",
            "ATA Class 401 - Master"
        };
        
        String selectedClass = (String) JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null,
            "Select the class to enter delay data:",
            "Class Selection",
            JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE,
            null,
            availableClasses,
            availableClasses[0]);
        
        if (selectedClass == null || selectedClass.trim().isEmpty()) {
            System.out.println("Class selection cancelled.");
            return false;
        }
        
        currentClassName = selectedClass;
        System.out.println("Class selected: " + currentClassName);
        return true;
    }
    
    /**
     * Initialize the data handler for server communication
     */
    private void initializeDataHandler() {
        System.out.println("Initializing data handler...");
        
        // Create data handler with current staff ID
        dataHandler = new DataHandler(DEFAULT_SERVER_URL, currentStaffId);
        
        // Test server connection
        System.out.println("Testing server connection...");
        boolean connectionTest = dataHandler.testConnection();
        
        if (!connectionTest) {
            System.out.println("Server connection test failed. Switching to simulation mode.");
            dataHandler.setSimulationMode(true);
            
            int response = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(null,
                "Cannot connect to the SMOS server. Continue in offline/simulation mode?",
                "Server Connection Error",
                JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION,
                JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);
            
            if (response != JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) {
                throw new RuntimeException("Application terminated due to server connection issues.");
            }
        } else {
            System.out.println("Server connection test successful.");
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Load student data for the selected class
     * @return List of Student objects or empty list if none found
     */
    private List<Student> loadClassStudents() {
        System.out.println("Loading students for class: " + currentClassName);
        
        // In a real application, this would fetch data from a database
        // For this example, we'll create sample data
        List<Student> students = new ArrayList<>();
        
        // Generate sample student data based on the class name
        int studentCount = 15; // Sample size
        for (int i = 1; i <= studentCount; i++) {
            String studentId = String.format("ATA%03d", i);
            String firstName = getSampleFirstName(i);
            String lastName = getSampleLastName(i);
            boolean isPresent = Math.random() > 0.1; // 90% attendance rate
            
            students.add(new Student(studentId, firstName, lastName, isPresent));
        }
        
        System.out.println("Loaded " + students.size() + " students.");
        return students;
    }
    
    /**
     * Start the main GUI with the student data
     * @param students List of students to display
     */
    private void startMainGUI(List<Student> students) {
        System.out.println("Starting main GUI...");
        
        // Create the GUI as per Events sequence step 1
        currentGUI = new InsertDelayAtaGUI(currentClassName, currentStaffId, students);
        
        // Set up data handler for the GUI
        currentGUI.setDataHandler(dataHandler);
        
        // Add window listener to handle interruptions (Postcondition: user interrupts operations)
        currentGUI.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter() {
            @Override
            public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) {
                handleUserInterruption();
            }
        });
        
        // Show the GUI
        currentGUI.setVisible(true);
        System.out.println("Main GUI is now visible.");
        
        // Log the application state
        logApplicationState();
    }
    
    /**
     * Handle user interruption as per postconditions
     */
    private void handleUserInterruption() {
        System.out.println("User interrupted operations.");
        
        // Check for pending data
        if (dataHandler != null && dataHandler.getPendingEntriesCount() > 0) {
            int response = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(null,
                "You have " + dataHandler.getPendingEntriesCount() + 
                " pending delay entries. Save before exiting?",
                "Pending Data",
                JOptionPane.YES_NO_CANCEL_OPTION,
                JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);
            
            if (response == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) {
                // Attempt to save data
                System.out.println("Attempting to save pending data before exit...");
                // In a real application, this would trigger data save
            } else if (response == JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION) {
                // Cancel exit
                if (currentGUI != null) {
                    currentGUI.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE);
                }
                return;
            }
        }
        
        // Handle SMOS server connection interruption (Postcondition)
        if (dataHandler != null && !dataHandler.testConnection()) {
            System.out.println("SMOS server connection interruption detected.");
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null,
                "SMOS server connection interrupted. Please check network connectivity.",
                "Server Connection",
                JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
        }
        
        // Exit the application
        System.out.println("Application terminating...");
        System.exit(0);
    }
    
    /**
     * Helper method to log application state
     */
    private void logApplicationState() {
        System.out.println("\n=== APPLICATION STATE ===");
        System.out.println("Staff ID: " + currentStaffId);
        System.out.println("Class: " + currentClassName);
        System.out.println("Server URL: " + (dataHandler != null ? dataHandler.getServerUrl() : "Not initialized"));
        System.out.println("Simulation Mode: " + (dataHandler != null && dataHandler.getOperationLog().contains("SIMULATION")));
        System.out.println("=========================\n");
    }
    
    /**
     * Get sample first name based on index (for demo data)
     */
    private String getSampleFirstName(int index) {
        String[] firstNames = {
            "John", "Jane", "Robert", "Emily", "Michael", "Sarah", "David", "Lisa", "James", "Jennifer",
            "William", "Mary", "Richard", "Patricia", "Charles", "Linda", "Thomas", "Barbara", "Christopher", "Susan"
        };
        return firstNames[(index - 1) % firstNames.length];
    }
    
    /**
     * Get sample last name based on index (for demo data)
     */
    private String getSampleLastName(int index) {
        String[] lastNames = {
            "Smith", "Johnson", "Williams", "Brown", "Jones", "Miller", "Davis", "Garcia", "Rodriguez", "Wilson",
            "Martinez", "Anderson", "Taylor", "Thomas", "Hernandez", "Moore", "Martin", "Jackson", "Thompson", "White"
        };
        return lastNames[(index - 1) % lastNames.length];
    }
    
    /**
     * Handle fatal application errors
     */
    private static void handleFatalError(String message, Exception e) {
        System.err.println("FATAL ERROR: " + message);
        e.printStackTrace();
        
        // Show error message to user
        SwingUtilities.invokeLater(() -> {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null,
                message + "\n\nError details: " + e.getMessage(),
                "Fatal Error",
                JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        });
        
        // Exit with error code
        System.exit(1);
    }
    
    /**
     * Authentication dialog for ATA staff login
     */
    private class AuthenticationDialog extends JDialog {
        private JTextField usernameField;
        private JPasswordField passwordField;
        private JButton loginButton;
        private JButton cancelButton;
        private boolean authenticated;
        private String staffId;
        
        public AuthenticationDialog() {
            super((JFrame) null, "ATA Staff Authentication", true);
            this.authenticated = false;
            this.staffId = null;
            
            initComponents();
            setupLayout();
            configureDialog();
        }
        
        private void initComponents() {
            usernameField = new JTextField(20);
            passwordField = new JPasswordField(20);
            
            // Set placeholder text
            usernameField.setText("ATA_Staff_");
            
            loginButton = new JButton("Login");
            loginButton.addActionListener(e -> onLogin());
            
            cancelButton = new JButton("Cancel");
            cancelButton.addActionListener(e -> onCancel());
            
            // Default button
            getRootPane().setDefaultButton(loginButton);
        }
        
        private void setupLayout() {
            JPanel mainPanel = new JPanel(new SpringLayout());
            
            // Add components
            mainPanel.add(new JLabel("Staff ID:"));
            mainPanel.add(usernameField);
            mainPanel.add(new JLabel("Password:"));
            mainPanel.add(passwordField);
            mainPanel.add(new JLabel(""));
            mainPanel.add(loginButton);
            mainPanel.add(new JLabel(""));
            mainPanel.add(cancelButton);
            
            // Layout configuration
            SpringUtilities.makeCompactGrid(mainPanel,
                4, 2, // rows, cols
                6, 6, // initX, initY
                6, 6); // xPad, yPad
            
            // Set layout and add components
            setLayout(new BorderLayout());
            add(mainPanel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
            
            // Add info label
            JLabel infoLabel = new JLabel("Enter your ATA staff credentials", JLabel.CENTER);
            infoLabel.setBorder(BorderFactory.createEmptyBorder(10, 10, 10, 10));
            add(infoLabel, BorderLayout.NORTH);
        }
        
        private void configureDialog() {
            setSize(300, 200);
            setLocationRelativeTo(null);
            setResizable(false);
            setDefaultCloseOperation(DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE);
        }
        
        private void onLogin() {
            String username = usernameField.getText().trim();
            char[] password = passwordField.getPassword();
            
            // Basic validation (in real app, this would connect to authentication service)
            if (username.isEmpty() || password.length == 0) {
                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this,
                    "Please enter both staff ID and password.",
                    "Validation Error",
                    JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);
                return;
            }
            
            // Demo authentication - accept any username starting with "ATA_"
            if (username.startsWith("ATA_")) {
                // Simulate authentication processing
                try {
                    Thread.sleep(500); // Simulate network delay
                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
                }
                
                this.staffId = username;
                this.authenticated = true;
                dispose();
                System.out.println("Authentication successful for: " + staffId);
            } else {
                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this,
                    "Invalid staff ID format. ATA staff IDs start with 'ATA_'",
                    "Authentication Failed",
                    JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
            }
        }
        
        private void onCancel() {
            this.authenticated = false;
            dispose();
        }
        
        public boolean isAuthenticated() {
            return authenticated;
        }
        
        public String getStaffId() {
            return staffId;
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * SpringLayout utilities for dialog layout
     */
    private static class SpringUtilities {
        public static void makeCompactGrid(Container parent,
                                         int rows, int cols,
                                         int initialX, int initialY,
                                         int xPad, int yPad) {
            SpringLayout layout;
            try {
                layout = (SpringLayout) parent.getLayout();
            } catch (ClassCastException exc) {
                System.err.println("The first argument to makeCompactGrid must use SpringLayout.");
                return;
            }

            Spring x = Spring.constant(initialX);
            for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
                Spring width = Spring.constant(0);
                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
                    width = Spring.max(width,
                            getConstraintsForCell(r, c, parent, cols).getWidth());
                }
                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
                    SpringLayout.Constraints constraints =
                            getConstraintsForCell(r, c, parent, cols);
                    constraints.setX(x);
                }
                x = Spring.sum(x, Spring.sum(width, Spring.constant(xPad)));
            }

            Spring y = Spring.constant(initialY);
            for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
                Spring height = Spring.constant(0);
                for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
                    height = Spring.max(height,
                            getConstraintsForCell(r, c, parent, cols).getHeight());
                }
                for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
                    SpringLayout.Constraints constraints =
                            getConstraintsForCell(r, c, parent, cols);
                    constraints.setY(y);
                }
                y = Spring.sum(y, Spring.sum(height, Spring.constant(yPad)));
            }

            SpringLayout.Constraints pCons = layout.getConstraints(parent);
            pCons.setConstraint(SpringLayout.SOUTH, y);
            pCons.setConstraint(SpringLayout.EAST, x);
        }
        
        private static SpringLayout.Constraints getConstraintsForCell(
                int row, int col, Container parent, int cols) {
            SpringLayout layout = (SpringLayout) parent.getLayout();
            Component c = parent.getComponent(row * cols + col);
            return layout.getConstraints(c);
        }
    }
}

an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are an autonomous programmer\n\nThe special interface consists of a file editor that shows you 100 lines of a file at a time.\n\nYou can use terminal commands (e.g., cat, ls, cd) by calling Terminal.run_command.\n\nYou should carefully observe the behavior and results of the previous action, and avoid triggering repeated errors.\n\nIn addition to the terminal, I also provide additional tools. \n\nIf provided an issue link, you first action must be navigate to the issue page using Browser tool to understand the issue.\n\nYour must check if the repository exists at the current path. If it exists, navigate to the repository path. If the repository doesn\'t exist, please download it and then navigate to it.\nAll subsequent actions must be performed within this repository path. Do not leave this directory to execute any actions at any time.\n\nNote:\n\n1. If you open a file and need to get to an area around a specific line that is not in the first 100 lines, say line 583, don\'t just use the scroll_down command multiple times. Instead, use the Editor.goto_line command. It\'s much quicker. \n2. Always make sure to look at the currently open file and the current working directory (which appears right after the currently open file). The currently open file might be in a different directory than the working directory! Note that some commands, such as \'create\', open files, so they might change the current open file.\n3. When using Editor.edit_file_by_replace, if there is no exact match, take the difference in indentation into consideration.\n4. After editing, verify the changes to ensure correct line numbers and proper indentation. Adhere to PEP8 standards for Python code.\n5. NOTE ABOUT THE EDIT COMMAND: Indentation really matters! When editing a file, make sure to insert appropriate indentation before each line! Ensuring the code adheres to PEP8 standards. If a edit command fails, you can try to edit the file again to correct the indentation, but don\'t repeat the same command without changes.\n6. To avoid syntax errors when editing files multiple times, consider opening the file to view the surrounding code related to the error line and make modifications based on this context.\n7. Ensure to observe the currently open file and the current working directory, which is displayed right after the open file. The open file might be in a different directory than the working directory. Remember, commands like \'create\' open files and might alter the current open file.\n8. Effectively using Use search commands (`search_dir`, `search_file`, `find_file`) and navigation commands (`open_file`, `goto_line`) to locate and modify files efficiently. The Editor tool can fully satisfy the requirements. Follow these steps and considerations for optimal results:\n\n9. When the edit fails, try to enlarge the range of code.\n10. You must use the Editor.open_file command to open a file before using the Editor tool\'s edit command to modify it. When you open a file, any currently open file will be automatically closed.\n11. Remember, when you use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the line numbers will change after the operation. Therefore, if there are multiple operations, perform only the first operation in the current response, and defer the subsequent operations to the next turn.\n11.1 Do not use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace more than once per command list.\n12. If you choose Editor.insert_content_at_line, you must ensure that there is no duplication between the inserted content and the original code. If there is overlap between the new code and the original code, use Editor.edit_file_by_replace instead.\n13. If you choose Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the original code that needs to be replaced must start at the beginning of the line and end at the end of the line\n14. When not specified, you should write files in a folder named "{project_name}_1766923906". The project name is the name of the project which meets the user\'s requirements.\n15. When provided system design or project schedule, you MUST read them first before making a plan, then adhere to them in your implementation, especially in the programming language, package, or framework. You MUST implement all code files prescribed in the system design or project schedule.\n16. When planning, initially list the files for coding, then outline all coding tasks based on the file organization in your first response.\n17. If you plan to read a file, do not include other plans in the same response.\n18. Write only one code file each time and provide its full implementation.\n19. When the requirement is simple, you don\'t need to create a plan, just do it right away.\n20. When using the editor, pay attention to current directory. When you use editor tools, the paths must be either absolute or relative to the editor\'s current directory.\n21. When planning, consider whether images are needed. studentTable.getColumnModel().getColumn(3).setPreferredWidth(60);  // Delay checkbox\n        studentTable.getColumnModel().getColumn(4).setPreferredWidth(100); // Delay minutes\n        \n        // Make the delay minutes column editable only when delay is checked\n        studentTable.getModel().addTableModelListener(new TableModelListener() {\n            @Override\n            public void tableChanged(TableModelEvent e) {\n                if (e.getColumn() == COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX) {\n                    int row = e.getFirstRow();\n                    boolean hasDelay = (Boolean) tableModel.getValueAt(row, COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX);\n                    tableModel.fireTableCellUpdated(row, COL_DELAY_MINUTES);\n                    \n                    // Enable/disable delay minutes editing\n                    if (!hasDelay) {\n                        // Clear delay minutes when delay is unchecked\n                        tableModel.setValueAt(0, row, COL_DELAY_MINUTES);\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n        });\n        \n        // Make delay minutes column use a spinner editor\n        JSpinner hourSpinner = new JSpinner(new SpinnerNumberModel(0, 0, 23, 1));\n        JSpinner minuteSpinner = new JSpinner(new SpinnerNumberModel(0, 0, 59, 5));\n        \n        // Create a custom editor for delay minutes\n        studentTable.getColumnModel().getColumn(COL_DELAY_MINUTES).setCellEditor(new DefaultCellEditor(\n                new JTextField() {\n                    @Override\n                    public void setText(String t) {\n                        super.setText(t);\n                    }\n                }\n        ));\n        \n        // Buttons\n        confirmButton = new JButton("Confirm");\n    \n        // Add padding\n        ((JPanel) getContentPane()).setBorder(BorderFactory.createEmptyBorder(10, 10, 10, 10));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Configure the main frame\n     */\n cancelButton) {\n            handleCancel();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handle Confirm button click\n     */\n    private void handleConfirm() {\n        try {\n            // Collect delay entries\n            List<DelayEntry> delayEntries = collectDelayEntries();\n            \n            if (delayEntries.isEmpty()) {\n                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this,\n                    "No delays selected. Please select at least one student with delay.",\n                    "No Delays Selected",\n                    JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);\n                return;\n            }\n {\n                    validationErrors.append("Invalid entry for student: ")\n                                   .append(entry.getStudentName())\n                                   .append("\\n");\n "Confirm Submission",\n                JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION);\n            \n            if (confirmation == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) {\n                // Send data to server\n                if All unsaved changes will be lost.",\n            "Confirm Cancel",\n            JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION,\n            JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);\n        \n        if (confirmation == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) {\n            // Close the application as per postconditions\n            dispose();\n            System.exit(0);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Collect delay entries from the table\n     * @return List of DelayEntry objects\n     */\n    private List<DelayEntry> collectDelayEntries() {\n        List<DelayEntry> entries = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        for (int i = 0; i < students.size(); i++) {\n            Student student = students.get(i);\n            Boolean hasDelay = (Boolean) tableModel.getValueAt(i, COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX);\n            Object minutesObj = tableModel.getValueAt(i, COL_DELAY_MINUTES);\n            \n            // Convert delay minutes to integer\n            int delayMinutes = 0;\n            if (minutesObj != null) {\n                if (minutesObj instanceof Number) {\n                    delayMinutes = ((Number) minutesObj).intValue();\n                } else if (minutesObj instanceof String) {\n                    try {\n                        delayMinutes = Integer.parseInt(minutesObj.toString());\n                    } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                        delayMinutes = 0;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Only create entry if delay is checked and minutes > 0\n            if (hasDelay != null && hasDelay && delayMinutes > 0) {\n                DelayEntry entry = new DelayEntry(\n                    student.getStudentId(),\n                    student.getFullName(),\n                    delayMinutes,\n                    currentClass,\n                    ataStaffName\n                );\n                entries.add(entry);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return entries;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * tableModel.setValueAt(false, i, COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX);\n            tableModel.setValueAt(0, i, COL_DELAY_MINUTES);\n        }\n        \n        // Reset status\n        statusLabel.setText("Form reset - Ready for new entries");\n        studentTable.repaint();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Custom table model for student data\n     */\n    private class StudentTableModel extends AbstractTableModel {\n        private final List<Student> students;\n        private final Class<?>[] columnClasses = {\n            Boolean.class, String.class, String.class, Boolean.class, Integer.class\n        };\n        \n        public StudentTableModel(List<Student> students) {\n            this.students = students;\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public int getRowCount() {\n            return students.size();\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public int getColumnCount() {\n            return COLUMN_NAMES.length;\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public String getColumnName(int column) {\n            return COLUMN_NAMES[column];\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public Class<?> getColumnClass(int columnIndex) {\n            return columnClasses[columnIndex];\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public boolean isCellEditable(int rowIndex, int columnIndex) {\n            // Only delay checkbox and delay minutes are editable\n            // Delay minutes is only editable when delay is checked (handled elsewhere)\n            return columnIndex == COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX || columnIndex == COL_DELAY_MINUTES;\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public Object getValueAt(int rowIndex, int columnIndex) {\n            Student student = students.get(rowIndex);\n            switch (columnIndex) {\n                case 0: // Present\n                    return student.isPresent();\n                case 1: // Student ID\n                    return student.getStudentId();\n                case 2: // Name\n                    return student.getFullName();\n                case 3: // Delay checkbox\n                    return student.hasDelay();\n                case 4: // Delay minutes\n                    return student.getDelayMinutes();\n                default:\n                    return null;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public void setValueAt(Object aValue, int rowIndex, int columnIndex) {\n            Student student = students.get(rowIndex);\n            switch (columnIndex) {\n                case 0: // Present\n                    student.setPresent((Boolean) aValue);\n                    break;\n                case 3: // Delay checkbox\n                    boolean hasDelay = (Boolean) aValue;\n                    student.setHasDelay(hasDelay);\n                    if (!hasDelay) {\n                        // Auto-clear delay minutes when delay is unchecked\n                        student.setDelayMinutes(0);\n                    }\n                    break;\n                case 4: // Delay minutes\n                    try {\n                        int minutes = 0;\n                        if (aValue != null) {\n                            if (aValue instanceof Number) {\n                                minutes = ((Number) aValue).intValue();\n                            } else if (aValue instanceof String) {\n                                minutes = Integer.parseInt(aValue.toString());\n                            }\n                        }\n                        student.setDelayMinutes(minutes);\n                        // Auto-check delay when minutes are set\n                        if (minutes > 0) {\n                            student.setHasDelay(true);\n                            fireTableCellUpdated(rowIndex, COL_DELAY_CHECKBOX);\n                        }\n                    } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                        // Keep current value if invalid\n                    }\n                    break;\n            }\n            fireTableCellUpdated(rowIndex, columnIndex);\n        }\n    }\n    \n
